Description: The RoboCamp Teacher Plan provides 1 year of unlimited access to all RoboCamp courses, covering over 298 lesson plans across LEGO® Education sets. This includes 25 SPIKE Essential lessons and 85 SPIKE Prime lessons (Beginner, Intermediate, Expert, and Short). The plan also features WeDo 2.0, EV3, and 3D Printing & Laser Cutting courses. All future updates and new courses are automatically added to the teacher’s account. The subscription is intended for one teacher and their students.
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors, Parents / homeschool
Hardware_Required_list: At least one of: SPIKE Prime, SPIKE Essential, WeDo 2.0, Mindstorms EV3
Skill_Progression: Covers progression Across courses — from SPIKE Essential and SPIKE Prime Beginner to Expert and Python-level robotics.
Why_This_Course_or_Plan:
Comprehensive Access – All lessons across LEGO SPIKE Essential, SPIKE Prime, WeDo, and EV3.
Includes Updates & New Courses – Automatically added during the subscription.
Cost-Effective – Best value for individual teachers.
All-in-One Solution – From beginner to expert, with additional 3D Printing & Laser Cutting modules.

Buyer_Role_list: Teacher, School principal, Program director, After-school owner

Description: The RoboCamp School Plan provides 1 year of unlimited access to all RoboCamp courses for all teachers in a school. It includes over 266 lesson plans, with 25 for SPIKE Essential and 65 for SPIKE Prime, plus WeDo 2.0, EV3, and 3D Printing & Laser Cutting. Any new lessons or courses released during the subscription are added automatically, ensuring the entire school benefits from the latest content.
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors, Parents / homeschool
Buyer_Role_list: School principal, Program director, After-school owner
Hardware_Required_list: At least one of: SPIKE Prime, SPIKE Essential, WeDo 2.0, Mindstorms EV3
Skill_Progression: Covers progression Across courses — from SPIKE Essential and SPIKE Prime Beginner to Expert and Python-level robotics.
Why_This_Course_or_Plan:
Full School Access – All teachers can use RoboCamp materials.
Extensive Library – All lessons across LEGO SPIKE Essential, SPIKE Prime, WeDo, and EV3.
Continuous Updates – New courses and lessons included automatically.
Best Value for Schools – Cost-effective solution for multiple educators.
Future-Proof – Keeps the school’s robotics program modern and comprehensive.

Plan: SPIKE Essential Programming Course Early Learners
Description: The course includes 25 structured lesson plans ( 60 minutes each) introducing students to programming with Icon Blocks using LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Essential. Step by step, students build and code original robot designs while learning the basics of coding, sensors, and mechanics. The curriculum is designed for young learners, helping them develop fundamental programming and engineering skills in a fun and structured way, aligned with STEAM and 21st-century education standards.
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors, Parents / homeschool
Buyer_Role_list: Teacher, After-school owner, School principal, Program director
Why_This_Course_or_Plan:
Perfect for Beginners – Easy-to-follow curriculum tailored to early learners.
Comprehensive Content – 25 lesson plans designed for a full school year.
Practical Teacher Training – 2 hours of expert online training included.
Engaging Builds – Students create unique RoboCamp-designed robots like Crane, Owl, Car Race, and Goat.
Interactive Learning – Encourages creativity, problem-solving, and teamwork.

Description: The course includes 15 structured lesson plans (45 minutes each) for programming in Word Blocks with LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Prime. Designed as simple starter lessons for early-stage learners and short class periods, it introduces motor control, sensors (touch, distance, color, tilt), loops, and conditionals through step-by-step builds. Sample projects include Swing, Safe Box, and Rangefinder. The curriculum is aligned with STEAM and 21st-century skills and is planned to expand to a total of 25 lessons (same 45-minute format).
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors, Parents / homeschool
Buyer_Role_list: Teacher, After-school owner, School principal, Program director
Why_This_Course_or_Plan:
Simple Starter Curriculum – Optimized for the youngest learners and short 45-minute classes.
Progressive Pathway – 15 lessons now, roadmap to 25 for a complete school-year program.
Word Blocks with SPIKE Prime – Clear introduction to motors, sensors, loops, and conditionals.
Classroom-friendly Builds – Quick, engaging projects (e.g., Swing, Safe Box, Rangefinder).
STEAM & 21st-Century Alignment – Builds problem-solving, creativity, and engineering thinking.

Description: The Intermediate SPIKE Prime course is a full-year, 25-lesson curriculum that transforms LEGO Education SPIKE Prime into an engaging gateway to coding, engineering and STEAM for ages 9-13+. Lessons begin with simple sequences and build up to variables, multithreading and fully autonomous robot systems. Designed for teachers and facilitators who want a powerful, ready-to-teach robotics program with minimal coding background required.
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors, Parents / homeschool
Buyer_Role_list: Teacher, After-school owner, School principal, Program director
Includes: 25 multimedia lesson plans with step-by-step build and code guides, signature robot projects (such as the Spirograph art machine, Forklift and Conveyor) that combine sensors, mechanics and programming logic. Teacher licence with unlimited student logins, on-demand webinar training, secure e-learning platform access, and dedicated expert support are included.
Why_This_Course_or_Plan:
Focused Curriculum – A full-year structured program (25 × 90 min lessons) dedicated to SPIKE Prime in Word Blocks.
Competition Readiness – Prepares students with essential coding and engineering skills for FLL and WRO.
Scalable Complexity – Lessons gradually increase in difficulty, supporting steady skill development.
Exclusive Designs – All robots are original RoboCamp projects, optimized for classroom learning.
Perfect for Schools with SPIKE Prime Sets – Tailored solution if the school primarily uses SPIKE Prime.

Plan: Kurs programowania SPIKE Prime dla zaawansowanych
Description:
The course currently offers 7 lesson plans (expanding to 10) that teach students how to design and 3D print custom LEGO-compatible parts for SPIKE Prime robots. Using mainly Tinkercad, with selected lessons in Fusion 360 and Blender, students learn step by step how to model small, practical elements that can be quickly produced on a school 3D printer. By enhancing robots with original parts such as manipulators, turbines, or sensors, students experience both engineering creativity and the real-world use of digital fabrication tools.
This course is currently available in beta version, offered at a reduced price until the full curriculum of 10 lessons is completed.
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors, Parents / homeschool
Buyer_Role_list: Teacher, After-school owner, School principal, Program director
Why_This_Course_or_Plan:
Dual Programming Approach – Lessons in both Word Blocks and Python, easing the shift to text-based coding.
Advanced Curriculum – 25 extended lessons (90 minutes each) with complex robotics projects.
AI & Machine Learning – Includes 2 (soon 4) lessons introducing practical ML and AI concepts.
Designed for Older Students (11+) – Perfect next step after the Intermediate course.
Challenging & Realistic Projects – Builds like Crane, Telegraph, Flight Simulator, Multi Sorter.
Competition-Ready – Strengthens coding and engineering skills useful for robotics tournaments.

Plan:
3D Modelling
and Printing Course Parts for LEGO SPIKE Prime robots
Description: The course currently offers 7 lesson plans (expanding to 10) that teach students how to design and 3D print custom LEGO-compatible parts for SPIKE Prime robots. Using mainly Tinkercad, with selected lessons in Fusion 360 and Blender, students learn step by step how to model small, practical elements that can be quickly produced on a school 3D printer. By enhancing robots with original parts such as manipulators, turbines, or sensors, students experience both engineering creativity and the real-world use of digital fabrication tools. The course helps schools make effective use of their 3D printers, often underused due to the time-consuming nature of larger prints.
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors, Parents / homeschool
Buyer_Role_list: Teacher, After-school owner, School principal, Program director
Why_This_Course_or_Plan:
Practical 3D Printing – Focus on small, fast-to-print parts suitable for school settings.
Hands-on Digital Fabrication – Students learn Tinkercad, with additional exposure to Fusion 360 and Blender.
Boosts Creativity – Enhances standard LEGO robots with unique, student-designed elements.
Effective Use of School 3D Printers – Makes printing feasible within class schedules.
Expanding Curriculum – Beta version with 7 lessons now, regularly updated until full release (10 lessons).

Plan: 2D Modelling and Laser Cutting Course Parts for LEGO SPIKE Prime robots
Description:
The course currently offers 4 lesson plans (expanding to 10) that teach students how to design and laser cut custom wooden parts for LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Prime robots. Using Tinkercad for modeling, students create components that can be cut in just minutes, making laser cutting a faster and more practical alternative to 3D printing in the classroom. The wooden parts add both functionality and aesthetics, turning robotics into a cross-disciplinary experience that combines engineering and art (STAM).
This course is currently available in beta version, offered at a reduced price until the full curriculum of 10 lessons is completed.
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors, Parents / homeschool
Buyer_Role_list: Teacher, After-school owner, School principal, Program director
Why_This_Course_or_Plan:
Fast & Practical – Parts that take 40 minutes to 3D print can be laser cut in just 5 minutes.
Tinkercad Integration – Simple, student-friendly design workflow.
Beautiful Results – Wooden elements enhance robots with professional and artistic look.
Expanding Curriculum – Beta version with 4 lessons now, regularly updated until full release (10 lessons).
Beyond STEAM – Introduces art and design, transforming robotics lessons into STAM experiences.

Plan: Programming WeDo 2.0 Robots: Beginner to Advanced course
Description: The course includes 25 structured lesson plans (60 minutes each) for programming in LEGO® Education WeDo 2.0. Students build and code original robots while learning key concepts such as loops, variables, and sensor input through step-by-step instructions. The curriculum provides a full-year learning path, from simple projects to advanced problem-solving, helping students develop logical thinking, creativity, and engineering skills. Although LEGO has officially discontinued support for WeDo 2.0, the set can still be successfully used in schools, especially as a bridge between SPIKE Essential and SPIKE Prime, making it ideal for 8–9 year olds.
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors, Parents / homeschool
Buyer_Role_list: Teacher, After-school owner, School principal, Program director
Why_This_Course_or_Plan:
Comprehensive Curriculum – 25 lessons covering beginner to advanced programming skills.
Hands-on Projects – Engaging builds such as Motorcycle, Ferris Wheel, Owl, and Spirograph.
Perfect for Schools with WeDo 2.0 Sets – Helps educators fully utilize the potential of sets they already own.
STEAM Alignment – Develops problem-solving, logical thinking, and creativity.
Teacher-Friendly – Includes introductory online training and ready-to-use materials.
Great Transition Tool – Fits perfectly between SPIKE Essential (younger students) and SPIKE Prime (older students).

Plan: Programming Mindstorms EV3 for Intermediate Learners course!
Description: The course includes 24 structured lesson plans (90 minutes each) for programming in LEGO® Mindstorms EV3, fully compatible with both EV3 Lab (legacy) and EV3 Classroom (modern) software. Students build and program advanced robots while exploring mechanics, sensors, loops, variables, and multithreading. Although LEGO has officially discontinued EV3, many schools still have the sets, and this curriculum allows them to fully unlock their potential. Designed for older students, the course develops problem-solving, programming, and engineering skills, making it an ideal step beyond WeDo or SPIKE Essential.
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors, Parents / homeschool
Buyer_Role_list: Teacher, After-school owner, School principal, Program director
Why_This_Course_or_Plan:
Dual Software Compatibility – Works with both EV3 Lab and EV3 Classroom.
Comprehensive Curriculum – 24 lessons designed for a full school year.
Advanced Robotics Projects – From vehicles and cranes to color sorters and simulation models.
Extended Use of Retired Sets – Perfect for schools that still have EV3 sets and want to maximize their value.
Skill Development – Builds programming proficiency, engineering knowledge, and teamwork.
Bridges Generations – Serves as a natural continuation after WeDo or SPIKE Essential.

Description:
Przykładowa, niewiążąca wycena uzupełniająca dla placówek posiadających zestawy LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Essential, przygotowana w celu przedłużenia dalszego użytkowania pracowni po wygaszeniu zestawu. 

Wycena obejmuje zestaw części zamiennych oraz dwie roczne licencje RoboCamp (poziom początkujący i średniozaawansowany), umożliwiające prowadzenie zajęć w oparciu o istniejący sprzęt przez jednego lub dwóch nauczycieli. 

Dokument ma charakter referencyjny i służy planowaniu budżetu, w szczególności w projektach grantowych lub modernizacyjnych.
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors (with existing SPIKE Essential sets)
Buyer_Role_list: School principal, Program director, After-school owner, ICT / STEM coordinator
License_Scope: Single or dual instructor (depending on course allocation)
Outcomes_list: Extended operational lifespan of existing LEGO SPIKE Essential labs, restored ability to conduct full robotics lessons using original hardware, structured teaching progression from beginner to intermediate level without replacing complete sets.
Includes: LEGO Education SPIKE Essential Replacement Parts Pack (additional construction elements for restoring and extending existing sets), LEGO Education SPIKE Essential rechargeable battery, LEGO Education SPIKE Essential small angular motors, RoboCamp 12-month digital license for LEGO SPIKE Essential programming – beginner level (Icon Blocks), RoboCamp 12-month digital license for LEGO SPIKE Essential programming – intermediate level (Word Blocks).
Why_This_Course_or_Plan: Enables continued use of existing SPIKE Essential labs without replacing full sets. Provides a structured teaching pathway from beginner to intermediate level using the same hardware. Designed as a cost-effective way to extend the educational lifecycle of discontinued LEGO Education equipment.

Description:
Przykładowa, niewiążąca wycena uzupełniająca dla szkół posiadających zestawy LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Prime (klasy 4–8), przygotowana w celu przedłużenia dalszego użytkowania istniejącej pracowni robotyki bez konieczności zakupu nowych zestawów bazowych.

Wycena obejmuje zestaw części zamiennych, akumulatory, serwomotory oraz roczne licencje RoboCamp na trzy poziomy programowania (początkujący, średniozaawansowany i zaawansowany), umożliwiające prowadzenie zajęć w oparciu o posiadany sprzęt przez jednego lub kilku nauczycieli.

Dokument ma charakter referencyjny i służy planowaniu budżetu, w szczególności w projektach grantowych oraz działaniach modernizacyjnych pracowni.
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors (with existing SPIKE Prime sets)
Buyer_Role_list: School principal, Program director, After-school owner, ICT / STEM coordinator
License_Scope: Single or dual instructor (depending on course allocation)
Outcomes_list: Extended lifespan of existing LEGO SPIKE Prime labs, restored ability to conduct advanced robotics lessons using original hardware, continuous programming progression from beginner to advanced level for students in grades 4–8 without purchasing new base sets.
Includes: LEGO Education SPIKE Prime Replacement Parts Pack (additional construction elements for restoring and extending existing sets), LEGO Education SPIKE Prime rechargeable batteries, LEGO Education SPIKE Prime large and medium angular motors, RoboCamp 12-month digital license for LEGO SPIKE Prime programming – beginner level (Word Blocks), RoboCamp 12-month digital license for LEGO SPIKE Prime programming – intermediate level (Word Blocks), RoboCamp 12-month digital license for LEGO SPIKE Prime programming – advanced level (Word Blocks and Python).
Why_This_Course_or_Plan: Provides a cost-effective way to extend the operational life of existing SPIKE Prime labs used in grades 4–8. Combines hardware restoration with a full programming progression from beginner to advanced level, allowing schools to continue and expand robotics education without replacing complete LEGO Education sets.

Description:
Przykładowa, niewiążąca wycena rozszerzająca dla szkół posiadających zestawy LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Prime, przygotowana w celu zwiększenia możliwości konstrukcyjnych istniejącej pracowni robotyki poprzez wprowadzenie technologii cięcia laserowego.

Wycena obejmuje desktopową wycinarkę laserową wraz z systemem filtracji powietrza, materiały eksploatacyjne oraz roczną licencję RoboCamp na kurs projektowania i wycinania elementów do robotów SPIKE Prime. Rozwiązanie umożliwia uczniom projektowanie indywidualnych części w aplikacji Tinkercad i wycinanie ich na laserze w celu rozbudowy i modyfikacji istniejących konstrukcji robotycznych.

Dokument ma charakter referencyjny i służy planowaniu budżetu pracowni technologicznej oraz integracji robotyki z projektowaniem 2D i wytwarzaniem cyfrowym.
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors (with existing SPIKE Prime sets)
Buyer_Role_list: School principal, Program director, After-school owner, ICT / STEM coordinator
Outcomes_list: Expanded construction possibilities for LEGO SPIKE Prime robots through custom laser-cut parts, integration of robotics with 2D design and digital fabrication, increased student creativity and engineering problem-solving without replacing existing robot sets.
Includes: Desktop laser cutting and engraving machine with integrated camera system, air filtration and fume extraction unit suitable for school use, consumable materials for laser cutting (wood-based sheets), RoboCamp 12-month digital license for designing and laser-cutting custom parts for LEGO SPIKE Prime robots (10 construction scenarios).
Why_This_Course_or_Plan:
Extends the construction capabilities of existing SPIKE Prime labs by introducing laser cutting as a fast and classroom-efficient fabrication technology. Laser cutting allows students to design and produce custom wooden parts significantly faster than typical 3D printing workflows, making it well suited for regular school lessons with limited time.

The use of laser-cut wooden elements also provides a high level of visual quality and aesthetic finish, enabling the creation of precise, durable, and visually attractive robot components. This extension is designed for schools seeking quick iteration cycles, immediate results, and visually refined constructions without replacing existing LEGO SPIKE Prime sets.
